name: JaMikal M
text: Penske trucks are governed at 65mph...which is understandable. But the acceleration of the truck was horrible on the 26ft box truck we got. Yes it was well weighted but I shouldn't be flooring and still can't get over 25mph when getting on the highway. Even on the highway, unless going down a slight hill it was almost impossible to get to 65mph. And going up hill the motor was dying. Alabama has some steep hills and the truck was barely making it. The mph were dropping while going up the hill. Please Penske, get trucks with a stronger motor! This is a safety hazard!

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time out to review our location. We appreciate the feedback on how we may be able to better our services. If you would like to discuss this further, we can be reached at 1(800)-467-3675.

name: Michael Paradis
text:
Penske has become a favorite for my family for the past two years and will remain our favorite truck rental company for the foreseeable future.  The initial contact, rental rates, in trip service and the drop off makes the customer feel appreciated because of services and courteous employees. I have used Penske on 5 separate times to affect my family's staged moves that saved me thousands of dollars.
I tip my hat to the company. Military families should call Penske first. You are VERY MUCH appreciated for your service to country Penske's appreciation keeps $$$ in your pocket.

text: Best Hertz rental location ever! Great service, and friendly staff! They rarely have high end cars but they always fulfill the reservation! Thank you!

name: Susan Raymond
text: Horrible experience!  Had a great rate 13-17 March booked a month in advance.  Called to add an extra day and clerk said it would change my rate and make the reservation double.  I said no thank you.  Came in on the 13th and they said I had no reservation for 13-17 March that "Travelocity" had changed it to the 12-17 Mar and now today they had no car for me! I had an email with the confirmation for 13-17 March and nothing else from Travelocity or Hertz saying anything had been changed!! Clerk made me feel like I was crazy. He did call Enterprise at the Airport to see if they had cars and they did so  I left and rented from Enterprise.  When I chatted with "Hertz Online Chat" they told me clerk had changed the reservation when I called, possibly by accident when checking the rates?? but did not tell me or send a confirmation email. I have screen shots from my Hertz Online Chat.  I know human error exists but the clerk made me think I was crazy for showing up on the 13th. At least the online chat helped me understand there was a MISTAKE BY HERTZ not me or Travelocity. So disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to rate & tell us about your experience with us, Susan. We hate to see that your experience was less than satisfactory. We hope you will give us a chance to provide you with a more positive experience in the future. We appreciate the feedback, and we will be sharing this with our team. -Bob

The Enterprise a couple of blocks away will help you through!

resp.text: Angelia, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

name: Barbara Sisson
text: We had a wonderful moving experience with Bolt Movers in Auburn. Price was reasonable and our 3 man crew Gabe, Jackson, and Chris were wonderful. We will request this team again for our next move. Moving is never fun for anyone. They were polite, respectful of us and each other throughout, hardworking, fun and made the most of a difficult heavy job and stressful time for everyone. They didn't smoke. The move took 13 hrs and they were great throughout. The Company is well run, process was smooth fr calling ofc to get info, scheduling the move, Billing, and the movers. It doesn't get better than this. Obviously screen their employees well. They are  extremely fortunate to have these 3 wonderful employees who did all the manual labor for us. HIGHLY recommend this company and especially these 3 movers.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Ms. Barbara!

name: Tori Phillips
text: My experience with Bolt Movers was absolutely exceptional. The pricing was very fair and scheduling was a breeze. What made the service especially impressive were the two movers who came, Bailey and Sam. They arrived within the time frame and immediately got started. From carefully moving every piece of furniture and box into my apartment, to assembling my desk and bed, and even helping to determine the best placement for the furniture in each room, they remained professional and were even enthusiastic to help. The day of my move in was extremely hot, but they still worked hard and made sure everything was done. I cannot say enough how much I appreciate Bolt Movers for making this move a breeze.

name: Solita Finley
text: The team of guys ( Jackson and Dima) were exceptional! They were as professional as I could hope for and they really made my move very easy for my husband and I. Can’t tell you how much they were appreciated. Keep up the great work guys. I would recommend this company to anyone wishing to move with no worries 😀

name: Mecy Calloway
text: Bolt Movers are AMAZING!! They are very professional and efficient!! I was amazed at how quickly they were able to load and unload all of my belongings on and off the truck! I would highly recommend to those looking for movers! They will not disappoint! Thank you for providing exceptional service Bolt Movers!!

name: LeAnn Rikard
text: I had a late cancellation with another company who refused to work with my schedule and I called Bolt Movers less than a week before I had to move and they had no problem taking care of everything! Our movers Sam, Gabe Harrison and Gabe MacKenzie were so efficient and professional they had everything done in just over two hours. It saved us so much time and stress that always comes with moving! Highly recommend this company to anyone getting ready to move!

name: Laura McGilberry
text: Bailey, Dina, and Tyler were a great crew!   They were very professional and polite.  They were very careful with all of our stuff. We will be requesting them when our out of town move occurs.

name: Lynne Hammond
text: Bolt Movers did a great job with our local move that involved three stops!  Our movers, Blake and Bailey, were prompt, professional, friendly and very easy to work with!!  This is the second time I have called on Bolt Movers, and both times they did a great job!    I highly recommend this company!

name: Amy Potter
text: After more than one bad moving experiences, I was overwhelmed at how great the team from Bolt(Emory, Tyler, Benjamin and Blake) were. They were incredibly respectful of our furniture- antiques and of me. This was not an easy move with difficult unloading and they all remained so positive. I recommend them without hesitation and will be using them again when we move again in a year. My thanks to this team!

name: Blair Beard
text: Over the years we have moved several times and always used different moving companies. We’re so thankful that Tyler showed up at our doorstep to give us a free gift and tell us about Bolt Movers once our house was listed. Tyler was friendly and came with a wealth of knowledge and helpful tips. We set up the move with Mariah and man, she has great customer service and was quick to send an estimate for the move. The day before the move Mariah checked in to confirm time and addresses and then the next day Cliff, Ben, Jackson, John Scott and Cody arrived with smiles on their faces ready to get our belongings to the next destination. They were all so friendly and did a great job working together as a team. We are already planning to use Bolt Movers again when we make a bigger move several hours away.  Great company, with awesome customer service and friendly staff. Thank you Bolt Movers!

name: Twenty-One Acres
text: Unbelievably impressed by the two gentlemen who helped us move yesterday! They were prompt, quick on their feet, incredibly polite, listened carefully, super careful and thoughtful. I was just blown away by their performance! I look forward to using their services again! You won't be disappointed!

name: Klaudia Virkler
text: We are beyond pleased with our experience with Bolt Movers. They helped move our family from Alabama to South Carolina. They were efficient, hard working, respectful, and had a positive attitude throughout the move. They didn't let us lift a finger. Communication was excellent! They were also reasonably priced and worked with us to fit our needs in every aspect. We already recommended them to our friends and would recommend them to anyone! Thank you Patrick!

name: Leslie Grimes
text: Got a move set up in less than a week. Two young men were quick, friendly and efficient. Would use again.

name: Kailey Montz
text: Cody and Ben did a great job! They worked very quickly and efficiently and did so with a smile on their face. They also treated my toddlers who were trying to “help” with so much kindness and patience. Highly recommend Bolt!

name: SN
text:
I used Bolt, Auburn to relocate within Georgia for my 2 bedroom apartment. I was very skeptical at using them as they were not local and were out of state company. I called 4 other companies apart from Bolt, and their quote was based on the distance of move and the weight. Bolt on the other hand, was based on the hourly rate. I saw their quote to be the least and was about $500 to $600 cheaper than other quotes. So I decided to go with Bolt.
I called them a day before my move and made sure everything is planned as scheduled. The driver called me on the day of the move and they reached my place 7 min before their scheduled time. They started working and were done loading all my stuff within 2.5 hours. They also reached my place of destination on time and unloaded materials quickly without damaging anything. They also used blankets and packing materials to secure items within the truck.
I am very satisfied with them and will recommend them highly.

name: Emily Carter
text: I highly recommend Bolt Movers. I had to delay my move twice and they accommodated me both times. The movers, TJ and Sean, were courteous, friendly, efficient, and professional. They treated my furniture and belongings as if they were theirs. Thanks, Bolt.

resp.text: Thanks so much! We appreciate you  :)

name: Kulton Jackson
text: Ian and Will did a FANTASTIC job! They showed up EARLIER than scheduled, got ALL the work knocked out in a timely fashion, and carried a great conversation for the entire move! I’m unpacking my stuff now and so far, everything is in good condition! Nothing is damaged or broken! A1 service, would highly recommend them for any moving job!

name: Kasey Shepherd
text:
Highly recommend!  Great price, very professional, all around an amazing experience!
My team of movers, Walter and Charlie, were AMAZING! They were so polite and professional, and they worked so hard despite the 90 degree heat and humidity.
Mariah was also so professional and answered all of my many questions promptly.  I will definitely be using this company for any future moves!

On moving day Emory and Brandon carried on with great service. Everything was done efficiently and with such good attitudes. I was helping my mother move from her home of 27 years to a retirement community. My mother’s house offered obstacles and challenges and they took them all in stride. They made what could have been a stressful experience very pleasant.

text: Sam & Frank were Awesome!... They moved me from my 3rd floor apt to my new place in 4Hours. I highly recommend Them

text:
Bolt Movers did an absolutely fantastic job moving us from Auburn to Birmingham. They were very professional, wasted no time and put my mind at ease that our furniture (including some rather fragile antiques) would arrive safe. The young men from Bolt were incredibly hard-working and handled all my requests with a smile. They reminded me several times that they were there to do whatever I wanted... making sure that I was satisfied was their main concern. The four guys (Caleb, Orlando, Jack and Lee) that made the whole trip - loaded and unloaded - were just super guys. I really liked them and trusted them with our belongings. There were 3 others that helped load but didn't make the trip to Birmingham - I can't remember their names, but they were awesome too!
These guys are just good people... and Patrick has them very well trained in how to treat their customers. I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone.

The guys worked quickly and quietly and were great about keeping us informed on their timeline for both pickup and delivery. I'll be using Bolt for any future moves!

text: Tortorigi is one that of the most awful companies I have ever done business with. Make a long story short I was there for a total of 6 hrs loaded secured and unloaded twice . My dispatcher had previously let them know my fee for the reload was 100 dollars. My fee for the extra weight was 100 dollars as well as my fee for detention was 50 dollars per hour for anything after being detained 2 hours. They agreed. After everything was said and done they only told me I would receive 100 dollars extra on my rate. I threatened to take load back and was awarded a total of three hundred dollars extra which is still 100 less than we agreed upon. I will never do business with this company again. Thank you, "Allen's Mobile Home Movers!" Get moved with the best, or left like the rest! If you need a mobile home moved, I suggest you call them! They're the best, and I'd suggest them to anyone! They have a GREAT group of guys, that work hard! I really can't thank them enough! It's been a rough ordeal but, y'all did it! 🙏❤️🙏❤️🙏❤️🙏❤️

I wish I could give them more than 5 stars, they deserve it. It's moving day and let me just start out by saying.......I'm glad and blessed to have: "Allen's Mobile Home Movers," to do the job. They've worked long and hard to get the job done. They've ran into many obstacles along the way and they've overcome, them ALL! They started last night, worked late and are back at it again today! They haven't let me down, at all! They are amazing people that care and get the job done right! I'd recommend them to anyone I know! They are reasonably priced and know what they are doing. We had a deadline to have the trailer moved and they met it. We love Wendy and Mike, they are like family now! If your needing a mobile home moved, then they are the ones to call! You won't be sorry! Thank y'all, so much! It means a LOT, to finally have this off my chest!

name: Dana Rogers
text: My husband rented a limo for our 25th anniversary. He wanted the night to be fabulous for us. We had a 2 hour drive to the restaurant we chose for the evening and decided it would be so nice to have a limo take us so we could enjoy our time together. When the limo came and we entered into the limo the car was disgusting. Apparently they had taken prom students over the weekend and our date was on Tuesday. It seems no one could clean the car between the the 2. The radio was broken the windows were all smeared up, glitter all over and the floors had mud on them. There was a knife with cake icing on it sticking out of the seat which in turn got icing on my dress. The driver was okay and drove very well  but the car was absolutely horrible. We were tempted to just cancel and drive ourselves but we had paid ahead of time and were afraid we wouldn’t get our money back.

name: G Brown
text:
Prestige Limo truly provides a world class service.  i have not needed a limo or car service in the Tuscaloosa area sadly for a while, since my Mama's death, but I am now booking several trips for a happy occasion - my nieces wedding!
After contacting Prestige Limo of Tuscaloosa for wedding car service arrangements I remembered I wanted to review and recommend Prestige based on my prior experiences with them.
My first experience with Prestige was when I needed a car service late night and last minute trying to get to Hale County from Birmingham Airport as my Mama was dying. I texted Prestige from my emergency flight from Mexico and Barry, the owner, was beyond compassionate and professional, and had a great driver waiting on me.
The car was immaculate but more importantly, was there early, and both the owner and driver so sensitive to my situation. The driver told me when we were nearing my Mother's house to just get out and run in and he would bring everything inside, which he did.  I literally do not know if I would have gotten all the way down to my Mother's house that night without Prestige.
I had the same professional experience booking today for my niece's pre wedding events and look forward to using Prestige for the wedding as well. I have traveled all over the world, had my own driver for years in NYC, but have never had a better car service experience.  Thank you Prestige.

name: kristine
text: The Prestige team has driven me more than 60 times this past year and has continued to exceed all my expectations on each trip. Mr. Fields (the owner) and his team are professional, pleasant, courteous, and safe drivers. They arrive on time, are up-to-date on any possible traffic delays with alternate routes ready, and know their client preferences (e.g., unique pick-up or drop-off locations; interior temperature; music, etc.). The team also are cognizant of any flight issues whether going to or leaving the airport. Several of my flights this past year have been delayed and I have been able to text/email/call to reschedule without further delay but in most cases, as soon as I knew of the schedule disruption, I received a text from the driver that they knew of the change already and would be there waiting for me as soon as I landed. Mr. Fields also is a wealth of assistance for transportation needs outside Alabama and has a network of colleagues with whom he can instantly connect you with. For example, when trying to get back to Alabama when a major airline had multiple disruptions and left thousands of travelers stranded in Atlanta, he was able to text within minutes of my request the names and numbers of several local companies who could get me back home. I appreciate this level of consistent service. Such proactive problem-solving and communication put me at ease knowing that my ride would be there – no matter how late the flight would arrive. I have made several last-minute requests (e.g., forgot to reserve a ride; had a game day request) over the year and they were able to accommodate them. The evening before each reservation, I receive an email confirming the pick-up time which is a helpful reminder and an opportunity to make any changes. I also receive a text or call from the driver a few minutes before each pick-up. That way, I know who to expect, if there will be any delays (never have been), or other changes in my reservation. Making a reservation with Prestige is easy to do with drop-down menus on my computer or phone. Also, the Prestige transportation fleet is clean and new with multiple options for any occasion. I have recommended Prestige to my colleagues and friends. Prestige offers an exemplary array of 24/7 services of which I will continue to use – in fact I already have multiple future reservations confirmed. Prestige, Mr. Fields, and his team are a true asset to those who need quality, safe, cost effective, and friendly transportation services.

text:
This company was used by my insurance roadside assistants. They said that because I had All-State insurance they were not putting me first because All-State doesn't pay well. That tells me that it's not about who is in need of help, but how our insurance pays them. I sat on the road for almost 6 hours with 3 kids.
When I called the place in which my car was to be towed, they said it was never delivered.
My vehicle was still sitting on the road even after I was sent a text saying it would be picked up at 4:37-4:52, only it was moved about 600 feet to where we initially stopped. The kids built a pyramid of rocks while playing in the ditch, which was approximately 600 feet to where the car was. Which tells me they loaded it then put it back down. WHY IN THE WORLD WOULD YOU DO THAT? Never again.

resp.text: This was on a very busy day, we told this potential client that we would get to her once we were finished with the calls that had come in earlier. She demanded that we get to her first and after some very uncomfortable phone calls we decided that we did not want to do business with said potential client. We informed the roadside insurance of this decision.

name: Michelle Smith
text: If you want to be talked over when trying to speak or talked rude to this is the company to use. I called them to explain something just like my insurance company asked me to do. Jason was very rude telling me I shouldn’t even be dealing with him only my insurance company should call him. First off its our vehicle and I’ll call all I need to about it especially when instructed to do so by my insurance company. I was belittled and talked to rudely. Our company will not use them again. We also requested our truck be dropped off at home 3 miles from the accident. He said oh no let me take it to my lot so the insurance company will come out faster. Which we let him do and it cost us $2800.00 because they didn’t come out faster and it sat there from 6/26-8/21. I’ll say the lady in the office was always nice when I spoke with her but Jason who I believe is the owner has no customer service skills. When someone calls to ask about their vehicle you should be willing to answer any questions they have and be nice about it regardless if they have their insurance company involved or not. Especially when you’re telling me a different story then my insurance adjuster told me minutes before I called you.

resp.text: This was not a issue on Ace Towing this was matter of insurance wasn’t notified properly, and when they did come we had to do what they told us to do, we strive daily to help and be reliable to ALL our customers. Thanks

text: This is the worst broker I have ever used they give the load to multiple truckers and then whoever gets there first they give it to and then make up lies as to why you didn’t get it even if you have a signed rate conformation. I dead headed for all most 200 miles on a emergency load for them and when I got there I found out someone else picked it up 15 minutes earlier then they made up a bunch of lies as to why I didn’t get the load. They said it was because I didn’t pass my background check for the pick up at military base but when I got there I passed with flying colors and they let me on the base only to find out they sold the load to someone else. I would highly recommend not using this lame excuse for a company.

name: Ken. R.
text: CARRIER AND CUSTOMERS BEWARE! Booked load with this company they canceled and refused to pay any Truck not in use fees because according to them  “they gave me plenty of notice” to rebook a new load. The notice came in 3 hours after rate con was signed. According to broker Sisi, she was canceling because our truck didn’t “fit the needs of the load because of weight restriction” even though we had discussed our available equipment and weight capacity prior to procceding with booking and she still confirmed us with rate con. We received cancelation at around 6pm eastern time (most brokers stop posting around 5pm and most good loads are already booked at that time) when I brought this up to her attention her reply was “well get your ass back on the boards and book another like everyone else instead of wasting time complaining to me!” She also said to me “I don’t know what country you are from...” as to imply because of my last name that I was either illiterate or illegal “but around here almost 24 hr notice is more than enough time for a cancelation.” No where in our signed rate confirmation or contract did it say they don’t pay truck not in use fees if they give “plenty of notice”. This caused my company  loss in wages as I still had to pay my driver and I missed out on an awesome paying load from a direct customer because we were already committed to Expedited Transport when the load was offered to us. Not only did they cancel the load and refused to pay compensation but the broker used foul and derogatory language and was completely unprofessional in handling our request for compensation. I reached out to the owner Tom Cross who pretty much said that the military is “wishy washy and that they have to cancel loads often because the military likes to change the items of the shipment without notice.” I noted to him that had I been told this with anticipation I would’ve opted to go into business with a different broker company rather than them because it’s poor business to be left up in the air and asked him if they advise of this on their contract because i did not see such a thing. He said that he would review it again and if it wasn’t that we could take up the conversation again. Upon reviewing it myself one more time I reached out to him because their was nothing advising the carrier that they don’t compensate for canceled loads. He never answered or returned my calls instead he sent me an email saying the industry standard is the day before without TONU. I would not trust booking a load with Expedited Transport or any of their affiliated companies (Unit Move Logistics, Hauling for Héroes) after all accountability is a two way street.

name: Bryan Greenwald
text:
I I had to plan a three day business trip to Birmingham, Alabama.  Having never been there, I was not interested in having to drive between different locations and risk getting lost and being late to meetings.  I found Alabama Sedan on the internet, and reached out to them via email.  Michael called me shortly thereafter and when I explained the various car rides I would require, he was careful to check his calendar to make sure he could accommodate me.
During the trip, Michael was very professional.  He always arrived early- including at the airport, at the hotel, and at the meeting locations.  He was always considerate to text me that he had arrived, but that there was no rush.  And most importantly, he did a great job planning the pickup times that would allow me to arrive at my destination in a timely manner.  There was one trip for which Michael was not available (and for which he had warned me in advance) and the person he arranged as backup was equally professional.
I don’t plan on returning to Birmingham in the near future, but if I do the first thing I will do is arrange to use Alabama Sedan again.  I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone who needs car transportation in that area.

name: Steven Mccornack
text: The negative review ("they never picked us up and we missed our plane") is FAKE!!!  I have used Alabama Sedan for TWO YEARS now - more than TWO DOZEN TIMES - and EACH and EVERY time they are EARLY!!  Their service is SUPERLATIVE: A+++.   They text me updates for the half-hour before pickup, to ease any possible uncertainty, and text upon their arrival (which averages about 10 minutes early).  Michael and his drivers are friendly, courteous, kind, and helpful, and their vehicles are clean and luxurious.  I use them for ALL my business travel (at least one trip a month), as does my wife, and I have recommended them to numerous colleagues (whose experiences mirror our own).  I also use them for personal travel as well - even in instances where I could just drive to the airport and park - because the experience is so positive.  Over the last two years I have gotten to know Michael well, and he is an honest, dedicated, high-integrity local entrepreneur.  I encourage everyone who needs a lift to the airport - or transport around or out of town in the Birmingham area (e.g., dinner dates out, etc.) - to use his service.  Anyone wishing to verify THIS review as legitimate is more than welcome to contact me - I am Dr. Steven McCornack, and I am a Professor in the Department of Communication Studies at the University of Alabama Birmingham.

resp.text:
Dr. Mccornack

Thank you for the passionate defense of our company. Your loyalty and continued patronage is very appreciated.

Michael Adlesperger
Alabama Sedan

name: Matt Cook
text:
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!USE HERTZ IN DOTHAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Rented once and attempted to rent once from the Enterprise Rental Car-Dothan location on Montgomery Highway.  Both times waited over an hour and a half.  This past time, Tuesday June 30th, I had a truck reserved at 8:00 per the app.  When I arrived there were 3 customers waiting outside.  Several employees,  I'd say 4-5 were sitting inside a cubicle talking while 1 person was washing cars. Apparently they don't clean any vehicle until the customer is there waiting.  They would casually check people in as they come up.  An hour later, I was still waiting with about 20 other people.  A gentleman questioned them about this, and they told him it was always an hour minimum wait for a vehicle there.  He took pictures of the one person washing.  They did not like this and asked him not to, then 3 started washing.  I inquired several times about the remaining wait time, and was told each time I was next up.  I clearly was not because I reserved a truck and could see no trucks being cleaned.  Even though the Hertz app showed no trucks, I called Hertz (AT 9:45) in desperation due a meeting I had several hours away.  The nice lady had 1 truck just returned and said she could have it ready once she sent it to the airport Hertz to be detailed.  I explained my frustration with Enterprise, and she told me to come on and get it.  She went out and cleaned it herself and had it ready when I made the 10-15 minute drive to Hertz.  I was in and out within 10 minutes of arriving.  I would pay double and go with Hertz vs. Enterprise now.  Thanks Hertz for the great customer service.

resp.text: Wow, thank you for five-stars, Matt! We're delighted you had a great experience and hope to see you in another Hertz rental soon! -Alexandra

text: I have had excellent service from the Hertz personnel and great rental vehicles .

name: Antron
text:
So although it was an extremely LONG wait to retrieve my vehicle (due to a long line and only one attendant working the counter) I must highly commend the associate for keeping her cool and remaining very professional, in spite of customers grilling her for the wait.

When it was finally my turn, she was still very pleasant and had a genuine smile. She also apologized for the tedious interim. I was very gracious for her apology and told her she was doing an excellent job--she really was. My forms were signed and ready in under 10 minutes.

The vehicle was relatively easy to locate, with a full tank of gas and clean interior & exterior. Very appreciative of the little things.

Thanks Hertz; my organization thanks you as well.

name: Benji Smith
text: I've been driven 30yrs so I know the deafferents between a good company and a bad one. From the first day Wright Trans impressed me. And That's not easy. They are big enough to be able to take care of there customers. They have customers that they have worked with for 20yrs. Yet they are small enough to know and care about there drivers. I requested an auto KW T680 and got it. Great truck. Good runs and all the miles you want. They let you run on your schedule. As long as the freight is getting moved, They don't care what schedule you keep. I meet both Wright brothers on the first day and better people you couldn't ask to work for. Professional and friendly. And my Dispatcher Karen? Best in the business. I'm totally happy work at this place.

name: Daniel Mccarra
text: You know when you walk into a place and they say make yourself at home and you just never feel comfortable doing it? Well you don't feel that way at Wright transportation. I was applying for a driver position with Wright transportation and from my first conversation with Trent the recruiter there I already felt pretty comfortable. She was very straight with me and did not try to put a apple in front of my face that I would never get to bite at some companies do. from the moment I walked through the front doors of Wright Transportation I literally felt right at home. My dispatcher Thelma has been great to work with and I see myself spending many more years with Wright transportation

resp.text: Thanks, Daniel! Glad you decided to join the team.

text: Worst company ever. cancelling a load in 1 hour prior pick up without any reason. Please avoid this guys

Both, carriers and brokers, have the main priority of servicing customers. If we ever make a decision to cancel a load, there is a reason. We should have done a better job of explaining the reasoning to you, and for that we apologize. Thanks for what you do on the brokerage side, we have to work together to keep America moving!

name: Kent Merritt
text:
I've been employed by Wright for just over a year, and I love it here.  Staff is knowledgeable and friendly but professional. My real only complaint is the cost of health insurance. They keep me running at my place, and don't harp on me for running my pace. This is the single best employer I've ever worked for.  I honestly believe that I will retire from here.  This is a truly family company who cares about their drivers as long as you are safe and get your runs done in a timely manner.  Dash cameras face forward only, and don't record sound.  We just had an incident recently where a aggressive and dangerous driver cut off one of our trucks and brake checked our driver, causing an accident. The camera saved our driver and company from false and tax money wasting court time by fly by night lawyers.

No Transportation company is perfect, as the trade has gone far downhill due to government overregulation and overreach, and the ELD's shortening our work days, and the widespread unprofessionalism of super truckers and undertrained steering wheel holders. But, Wright is as good of a general carrier with dry vans that I have ever heard of. Yes, I  could get into specialized hauling and make more money, but Wright has done nothing for me to want to leave them.

name: Deborah Storey
text: My mom (Martha Tarrrance) used your service the divers was very nice, but a few days ago ,the nurse called  your office for her to be picked up at 3:45 she was told that she could not call there and tell them that she was ready. so they called me to pick her up  , when I got there a young lady was stand by the van smoking a cigarette and talking on the phone , I asked if she was there to pick my mom up she told me no. The next day someone from your office call my and want to know what happen and I told her about the young lady .Then she called me back to tell me that my mom could not  use their service because,  I said I would beat the driver  a__. I am 60 years old and I would not put myself in danger. The bad thing about it  was your company made a decision without   an investigation . So your company did not  care about my mom health . That is patient neglect . When there have been so many times I have had to pick her or carry her,  because your company could not for what ever reason. I think the young lady lied to save her job, but I hope she knows GOD sit high and he looks low.

name: Lisa Mardis
text: (MTA) Medical Transportation Associations has its excellent service but are alleged to be disorganized and/or non existent policies, procedures, and protocols. To have these 3 in place, it is essential to provide to the client a copy of such procedures. All drivers were on time, dispatchers answered calls clearly. However on my second ride I had the unfortunate mishap of leaving medication within the van. They have no formal policy notated on site for events such as this. The following were their response: 1)."We cannot call the transporter ( what if an appointment is canceled or their is an emergency shouldn't MTA have a contact procedure)";2) We don't know where the driver is located , 3:) We will mail you your medication ( medication is essential to everyone's health, being that you are transporting individuals who are sick ad disabled);4) The driver will bring a card swipe to charge you for your item(s) that you left; 5) We will place it in the mail COD and you will pay for postage; 6) No we don't send the driver with a swipe cared to charge you ; How much is the charge? Answer: I don"t know, Question: When will he come? Answer I don't know ;7), I will call you back at the end of the drivers shift to see if medication was found; 8) Can't you call your doctor  for more medication and pay. No follow-up calls were made. These were the previous responses.A Medical transport Service would have in place a CB or cell phone to contact the driver in case of cancellations, lost items, or medications such as within my case. I am not excusing my fault for leaving the medication as I have a bladder issues and was in a rush to get to the bathroom. However, It is stated on their website that a policy to have open communication from the dispatcher to the drivers is needed and are in place in all probability, however the supervisor failed or refused to use such action available to her to secure my property (medication). Drivers excellent safe, timely, customer service courteous. However those who implement any policy known or unknown to to they are in need of training, or the owner or person(s) in charge has not provided such polices, such for medications left in van, etc, and may be in violations of Medicaid and the Disabilities act. Example a person has seizures leaves medication in van, they in turn contact MTA to return medication, MTA state they will mail the medication without immediately contacting the driver who can within 1 minute find the medication ad secure it from being obtained from the next rider who may find and keep the medication. Meanwhile said rider has a seize. The question remains would mailing the medication to the ride help and stop a seizure. In my case , I called before the driver got to the corner on my block which would have only took 1.5 minutes to turn and return medication, without disruption of his route timing. I am requesting a copy of MTA polices to be distributed to all riders. This is only fair. I gave three stars for excellent customer service, excellent driver riding experience as they were wonderful, but  stars were decreased due to my allegations of lack in mismanagement either on the part of the acting manager or the owner(s). Customer service and drivers look to management for training and guidance.

name: Kellee

name: Jackie Savadge
text:
My caregiver and I have had great experiences with most drivers. BUT I had a heart attack on the 18th. I saw my primary care doctor the next week. I use a wheelchair and need my caregiver to help me get into and out of doctors offices ect. My doctor called an ambulance to her office to admit me back into the hospital with my heart. MTA refused to pick my caregiver up and return her home! Since I wasn't with her she couldn't ride they said.
That is so morally wrong I'm at a loss to even try to explain why.
Without my caregiver I'd be unable to go anywhere. Why would anyone want to accompany a disabled person if they may be deserted?
I was lying in the e.r with my heart acting up having to worry about her being stuck there. A kind nurse gave her a bus pass and she got safely home.
I'm having chest pain after a stint. But I'm afraid to go on MTA.

UPDATE: I RECIEVED A CALL FROM THE DIRECTOR TODAY...I DONT REMEMBER HIS NAME.
SOMEONE CALLED MTA AND WAS TOLD THEY WOULD TAKE HER FOR A FEE WHEN I WAS AT THE E.R. WE NEVER GOT THAT MESSAGE.
HE TOLD ME HOW PASSIONATE HE IS ABOUT MTA AND HOW TO SOLVE THE PROBLEM GET TWO AUTHORIZATION NUMBERS FROM MEDICAID.
AFTER TALKING TO THE DIRECTOR I HAVE A LOT OF RESPECT FOR HIS WHAT HES DOING WITH MTA.
I AM SATISFIED THAT WE CAN RIDE WITH MTA AND RETURN HOME SAFELY.
THANK YOU MR DIRECTOR.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. MTA did not refuse to take your care giver home . There would of been a fee for her to ride with out you.Your insurance pays for you to ride and we do not charge for your care giver to ride like other companies. So for her to ride home by herself there is a charge. If you would like to discuss more please call me at 1888-599-2050 ext 212.

And I told him that and ask how would I get home if the phone was still not working when I was ready to leave. He told me that was not his problem. Ok so when I was ready to go luckily the phone was working and I called and only had to wait 30 minutes for the driver to get there. This driver commences to drop the F bomb in every sentence. Talking about they done sent her way the F*** out here at this F***ing time of day and how was she gonna pick her F***ing kids up on time. She was texting on her phone and nearly hit a car. I was having a panic attack. Then on the 26th of September had an appointment at 2:00 and my driver showed up at 2:20 and informed me that he would not be able to get me to my doctor for another 45 minutes. He said he had to pick up another patient first. Needless to say I just stayed home. My driver showed up at 8:20 and I arrived at doctor at 8:50. At 10:00 I was through an called for my return ride home. 2 hours and 45 mins later I was picked up. On October 2nd I had an 8:15 appointment my driver showed up at 9:00 I just rescheduled.

name: Debby Fischer
text: I used G an G Auto to ship my car from Sacramento to  the Trenton TX area. I paid their deposit of $150 after they first quoted $100 and quoted first $800 then $850 to do the job. My son signed the contract and then the issues started. They were supposed to pick up my car on March 26, 2021 so it could get to Trenton Tx by end of March. They never called and I had to call them. Told me the driver is running late will call in the AM of March 27, 2021. Never called and no pick up. This repeated for 2 days. No one ever called back and I always had to chase them. Finally, a supervisor called back told me they driver was AWOL, the guy John who I was dealing with was fired and now they have to find a new driver,  like that was my fault. Took them days to get back to me after I spoke to another supervisor who said she would call back and guess what… no call back. Finally, they said the had a new driver and it would cost $1400 with $150 already paid so I would have to pay the driver $1250. After my son already signed a contract for $850. When I asked for a discount for my trouble and extra cost to rent my rental car for another week they told me no. I do not know how this company has such a high rating with the BBB when they obviously extorted $400 dollars from me to get my car to Trenton TX and another $700 for the extra week of my car rental. Not to mention they never called back and were dishonest from the beginning. This company is horrible. Find a different company and do not  trust rating from the BBB.

At 8 PM I receive a text from Adam saying they have a truck for $900 that can pick my vehicle up Sunday.  This is two days later than my original quote I and $300 more.  If you do not want your time wasted, use another company.

I was told the vehicle was not ready, and that at least five more customers were in line ahead of me before my vehicle would be ready. At this location, the service desks for Hertz, Thrifty, and Dollar are combined - I had a very similar experience three months ago at Thrifty at the Mobile Airport. During this occasion, I set my rental car pick up for 6:00 PM and did not have a vehicle until 11:12 PM. This experience influenced me to set my pick up time for noon today and not pick it up until later, just in the chance that this happened again. It unfortunately did not help. The desk representative was pleasant to speak with, but I will no longer rent from this location.

resp.text: Kaitlin, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

name: Michael Deas
text:
Normally service at MOB has been friendly and dependable. This time, however, on Wed 24 Oct, I was given a car smaller than I reserved, which was not acceptable for this trip (carrying passengers). When I asked for a replacement, I was given a vehicle with 47,000 miles on it that apparently had not been thoroughly checked. By that evening, the key fob was acting up. By the next morning, the battery was dead. After reporting to Hertz, I had to unload the car in the rain, catch a ride with a friend, and continue my meetings, then catch a Lyft to the airport. Hertz sent for a tow truck to get the car, which was picked up at 9:48 on Thu 25 Oct. Yet Hertz charged me for two extra days that I did not use, and then to add insult to injury, also added a late fee. All this after having been on the phone with Hertz 5 times that morning to get their car taken care of. I explained all this to the agents at MOB; they gave me the number of their manager, whom I called and left a voicemail for. I received no call back. When I called the corporate office about the bill, I was told I would get a $20 discount on the bill--even though they charged me for two extra days that I didn't even have the car.
After 22 years of being a customer, I mistakenly thought I would be treated better than this.

name: JaTori Thomas
text: The worst! I have literally been calling Hertz since for the past hour to speak to one of the two females at the desk. I’ve made 15+ calls. A few of them were picked up and hung up. I also reached out to the 1-800 line, the nice representative attempted to call the Airport location 3 times as well. Not to mention, I had to wait an hour and half after my scheduled reservation just to get a vehicle for them to give my vehicle away. This is awful customer service. You all should think about hiring more associates if you are short staffed or hiring people who actually want to make your reputable business remain at the top of quality service.

name: Crackon
text: poor car management, poor service, uncaring. 73 yr old mother had to wait over 4hrs to get her car she reserved. this forced her to get a hotel and pick the car up on the morning.  no restitution or apology. only after complaining to corporate, online and to Expedia(booked with them) did they offer no charge for the gas.  They should have offered a reasonable amount for a hotel and have the car in the morning.  this would have helped her specific reservation about not driving at night and alleviated their car shortage problem.

text: I will never use Hertz at this airport again. I got off my flight early and went to get my rental car. I was notified they didnthave one ready that I had to wait for my pickup time. Not a big deal, waited the twenty minutes. Then I asked again and they told me they still didnt have a car for me. That I should again have a seat and wait. They wouldnt let me know how long a car would take or the status of a car. All they would say is they have luxury cars avaliable if I wanted to upgrade. It took them a half an hour past my pick up time. I called hertz customer service durring this time and they basically said this is a small shop and they overbook the cars and sometimes you have to wait until another person returns a car before one is ready even if you have a reservation. Once I finally got a car it was filthy inside and windshield was gross. It was wet on the outside like they sprayed it with a hose but they didnt clean it. I rent from hertz all over the country and will say this was my worst experience. There customer service was atrocious.

name: Mark Crable
text:
I arrived into Mobile Regional Airport quite late due to a missed connection in Charlotte, NC. (Flight leaving CVG was 1 hour late departing.)

Hertz had eliminated my reservation for a rental car and only had a small Hyundi and a mini-van left. I elected the Hyundi. It's brakes were a bit grabby and the driver's side carpet behind the gas pedal was worn and torn. Otherwise . . . it was okay.

The rental agent told me that my credit card on file had been declined. So I used a debit card for the rental. Later I discovered that Hertz had tried to hold $350+ on my credit card twice . . . thus maxing it out. (I am between jobs and was in Alabama for an interview.)

Other than that, the rental car and process was fine. When I got to my hotel in Jackson, AL, I discovered that the travel agency had reserved a room for me in Jackson, MS. So, I slept in the rental car at the parking lot of the McDonald's in Jackson, AL. The rental was okay for sleeping with a driver's seat that reclined nicely. But, at that point, I'd wished I'd rented the mini-van.

Great trip!

Oh, and the interview went well as did the trip home to Cincinnati.
- Mark

text:
Pease don't send your drivers out to Colorado if they don't know the simple laws of the road.I watched and followed one of your drivers for over a hundred miles purposely impeding traffic while Hauling a ISO hazmat load.  Since your drivers don't know how to read I'll explain this very simple LAW. Colorado has very mountainous terrain. Colorado has these things called passing lanes and climbing Lanes. These lanes are on average five miles long every 20 to 30 miles.  Every passing Lane has a sign that says keep right except to pass. That does not mean hang out in the left lane and make sure nobody passes you on the right by pacing the are there professional driver keeping right allowing people to pass. But no, you sat there four different times and completed zero passes.
So please do not give truck drivers a bad reputation. move over and let some people pass, some of us drivers actually know how to pull hills.

text: Booked a reservation for a business trip. Showed up to pick up the car and was told nothing was available. Never received a call to inform me of the issue so that I could plan accordingly.

name: Sarah Torgersen
text: LaRae was very professional and efficient.  My vehicle was ready as reserved.  One drawback is that this location requires the Insurance Declaration page vs. the standard Proof of Insurance card I have in my wallet.  I was able to download and email it in about 5 minutes, but it was unexpected.  Return process was easy.  I always stay to get my receipt, that way I am not surprised by charges.

resp.text: Thank you for the high rating, Sarah. We hope you'll give us the chance to earn your 5-stars during your future Hertz rental. -Alexandra

name: James Jaillet
text:
Seconding some reviews I've seen here: THE WORST.

Terrible service, for starters. Secondly, they charged me double the amount I was told it would be. Staff is unhelpful at best, really rude at worst. I'd avoid renting from this location if possible.

I had to sit and wait for nearly an hour the morning of my reservation (despite being the only customer there) because they required an obscure insurance documentation — rather than the standard proof of insurance card in my wallet that, for instance, you'd show a police officer at roadside. It made me an hour late to my destination.

After I dropped the car off, I pulled up my receipt online a few weeks later and realized I'd been charged double what they'd told me on the phone. They have a 24-hour policy and will charge you for two days if you don't return the car within 24 hours. I was not told this was the case; when I booked, I told them my plans for pick-up time and drop-off time, and they told me the price. Likewise, I told them when I'd return the car the morning I picked it up, and still no one said it would be a two-day charge. Lastly, when I dropped the vehicle off, no one told me I would be charged for two days.

I called to discuss the two-day charge with the staff and was met with rigidity, interruptions and hostility -- absolutely no care or concern for the issues at hand and, obviously, absolutely no attempts to rectify what I perceived as an intentional misunderstanding meant to charge me for two days instead of for the single-day reservation.

Lastly, this is a privately owned location, so any concerns you have cannot be addressed by the broader Hertz company.

resp.text: James, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review at Hertz Car Rental. We are sad to hear that we missed the mark this time, and would love the opportunity to hear from you! If you haven't already, could you reach out to us on Facebook Messenger at: m.me/hertz  Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. -Emily

name: Kelly Bringier
text: Very helpful & good svc. Good prices for the car we needed. Def will use again.

resp.text: Kelly, thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam ~Nikeya

name: Julie Noles
text: The worst. Made a reservation for a car over a week ago. Time came to get the car and they say they have no cars. What was my reservation for? They said they did not have even one car on their lot. Not to mention we had been trying to call them for a week but no one ever answered the phone and they didn't check the multiple messages we left. No one wants this level of difficulty. It's ridiculous.

resp.text: Julie, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam~Nikeya

name: Dawn Rodgers
text: I have always rented from Enterprise.  And after this experience, I will never rent from Hertz.  State Farm set me up with Hertz after one of their customers hit me.   The office was a mess, papers scattered around on floor and table (get some filing cabinets). The male Hertz employee had a mouth of chew.  He literally spit his chew into a plastic coke bottle in front of me and my daughter.  I thought I was going to puke 🤮 I had issues with the vehicle they rented me.  I brought back to exchange.  No professionalism.  The girl just complained the whole time, slammed papers and pens on desk.  I understand having a rough day but you have to keep it together.  I would think twice before you rent from Hertz on Madison Blvd. in Madison.

name: Sara Robinson
text: Awful. Did not communicate well with the insurance company of the person who totaled my car & temporarily charged my card over $500 even though it was clarified upfront that I was not the financially responsible party. 0/10 Would not recommend.

resp.text: It's upsetting to see that we didn't provide you with the experience that we expect for our customers. Could you do me a favor and email us at: https://www.hertz.com/rentacar/customersupport/index.jsp?targetPage=contactUsView.jsp?CUS_key=2&CUS_keyText=A%20Past%20Rental%20-%20Billing%20Questions%20or%20Comments/Feedback&CUS_routing=P&CUS_category=CON_US_PAST_RENTAL so that we can have a better understanding of where we can improve? - Justin

name: Blake Hargrove
text: I was a little preturbed with this rental service. I called approximately 10 days in advance to check the availability of a certain type of vehicle. This rental involved my auto insurance, as I understand the process is different than a standard rental. Their staff I formed me they would be able to have the type of vehicle (small/mid SUV) I needed when I came to pick it up. When I showed up, I was I formed all I could get was a Sedan, or wait a few hours, and I could possibly get an SUV as originally requested.

name: Christy Poston
text: I have never experienced issues with this Hertz location. Its definitely better than Avis and Enterprise. I wish they were open longer on Saturdays but I will take what I can get 😉

name: Kimberly Elliott
text: Called to see about setting up a rental. I was put on hold for several minutes and then no one answered. I filled out the rental reservation form on the website with my insurance claim number, and they sent me a confirmation email. Went to pick up the rental, and they couldn't find my reservation. Horrible customer service. The guy was watching a video on his phone the entire time he was helping me. This was my first and last experience with Hertz.

name: Tim Townsend
text: Hertz has some messed up categories. We reserved a Chevy Equinox 6 cyl Crossover (car frame) and wound up with a Dodge Durango 8 cyl (on a truck frame).  The Durango weighs almost 2000 lbs more.  We were already at the Hertz site & had 2 choices, take the Durango or walk away.  We were ready for our trip so I took it.  Wow, the Equinox has 2 rows of seats while the Durango has 3 rows and rides heavy.  My wife was getting car sickness from the sway on turns on the interstate.  Hertz needs to reevaluate their categories as the Hertz rep told me the two are in the same category!!!

resp.text: Tim, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We're disappointed to hear that you didn't have a great experience with us.  We'd like for you to reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

name: Dustin Beverly
text: I rent from this location multiple times a month. The staff are very understanding and laid back. I highly recommend!

name: Dominic Moore
text: The team of mike and La'Nae are so awsome . they are very professional and helpful. I will refer them to all my family and friends

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam - Justin

name: Robin Heath
text: Awesome and courteous service. Great price

name: Greta Strickland
text: Very pleasant experience, loved the staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the awesome feedback Greta! I am so happy our staff took great care of you and  we hope to service you again soon!  😊 -Justynne

name: Scarlet Pennrose
text: Horrible customer service. The guy up front gave me attitude when I was asking him questions about the pricing, because I had never rented a car before. They talked about using Hertz cars off the clock and laughed about it. Then he handed me the keys and said the car was out front. I said, "Okay. What car is it?" He said, "It's out front." I said, "There are 20 cars out front." He replied with, "Just click the button. You'll see it." Not cool.

name: Claudia Nowlan
text: The car was great....awesome service!!!

name: Aaron Lutz
text: Very easy to work with staff. They were the cheaper than enterprise. It was a $50 differece one way. I didnt like I was told all locations would be open for drop off but they were not. Next time renting a car will most likely go through them again.

name: Steve L
text: Very pleasant employees.

resp.text: Steve, It's such an honor to receive positive feedback from our customers.  Our goal is to always provide our customers with an all-around stellar experience. Glad to hear that  we met your expectations, and created great memories with you. We look forward to seeing you soon!~Emily

name: Jan Waldrom
text: Awful service, incompetent manager!  Car was being repaired at repair shop.   I called for a week to reserve an SUV and was asked repeatedly to call back every 12 hrs or so to see what they had. Evidently,  no system exist  for tracking in/out coming cars.  Never had answers, just a bunch of I don't knows.  Extremely unproffessional.  Went some where else.

name: April Goodmon
text: 1 star because it won't let me leave 0. The absolute worst service. I had a car accident and my insurance company sent my rental car reservation there. It was right before closing so, I called first thing the next day, the day of my sisters wedding, and was told I would get a call back. An hour later, the lady calls me back and asked what kind of box truck I was wanting. When I explained that I needed a rental car and to be picked up, she said that was a whole other inventory and she needed to call me back, again. She never called me back.

name: Lillian Hardley
text: Great custom service.

name: Brett Millar
text: Great People and Service.

name: Carly Lee
text: Never rented a car until I got one here...what a pleasant experience. I will be back.

name: Michael C. Hayes
text: Great service

name: Wayne
text: Small place with a small selection, but the people there really worked hard to help me out when I was in need.

name: Project Hexx
text: Great Service Manager name Cliff

name: Mandy Hunter
text: I typically do not write reviews about service, but the customer service with this company is TERRIBLE!!  We order items for insureds who have lost stuff in fires, hurricanes, thefts, etc.  XPO Logistics called our office about setting up a delivery of Serta mattress (we ordered from Sam's Club).  We gave them the insured phone # and told them that it would be best to call them directly.  They called us back 4 different times asking the same info.  I contacted them and looks like EVERY ONE we talked, all 5  times failed to put the correct # in the system and had not reached out to our insured about delivery.  This family went through a hurricane and XPO Logistics had their mattress for 3 plus weeks and failed to contact my customer and when I called I was told the 1st available delivery was 2 weeks out.  I explained this was not acceptable as we had given them the contact # 5 times and they failed to contact them.  I asked for a manager and was told the only way to contact them was by email (as it seems they send their customer service off-shore).  I gave Mal (XPO rep) my person cell # as I would not be in the office at 8 pm and needed this resolved.  NO CALL.  I called the next day and got the same story from Cissel and guess what NO CALL.  This company has horrible customer service and if you are a business who uses them to ship your product I would think twice as the customers on this side are receiving very poor service.

name: Cary Ward
text: Unprofessional drivers with idaf attitudes and the office personnel aren't any better. Absolutely no follow-up on trying to file a damage claim, that's where the low rating on the driver in a rush and " didn't know how to list it" on the bill of lading.

name: Richard Patino
text: Good service

name: Ciochina Adriana
text: Worst experience to deal with brokers, my truck was sitting for 2 days,because their appt was 2 days later than the one on the rate conf, they did not do anything, just made us wait for the appt to give us  $150/day (for reefer to hold their product and to pay driver).No manager helped, they didn’t care that we are sitting and that they are paying us this amount for a reefer load.They have  many fines for the carrier, but they pay $150 layover.Did a short run for California to AZ, 4 days for 360 miles, for 2 days 300$ layover for a reefer.When they unloaded my truck it took like 8h, they told me detention is paid after 60 days.Terrible job, the broker is Richard Atkins and his team.Please stay away from this kind of loads and brokers if you’re not trying to loose money  and your time.
